hints.0: On most farms, large farms, production means more than that. This canon accepted Bituricens.
hints.1: More and more different monsters spawn for the settlers.
hints.10: 3x33 is the optimal size for a forester.
hints.11: Instead of cutting the edges, press 'CTRL' to straighten them.
hints.13: To set the second area with the same settings, hold down the 'CTRL' key while placing the build area.
hints.14: Colony Survival has many features. Find us on our Steam or Discord forums!
hints.15: You can also search the stack using general terms like 'food' and 'grocery.'
hints.2: Some of the world's strata contain minerals. Dig deep to find other mines.
hints.4: Click on action blocks to see how they are used and to prioritize specific triggers.
hints.5: Press 'F1' to manually turn on and off.
hints.6: Science uses the contents of the science bag, but the linen bag itself is often returned.
hints.7: Varying range, speed, and damage reloads give each type of guard its own strengths and weaknesses.
hints.8: We blog every week. Visit our website to learn more about the progress of Colony Survival!
hints.9: Shots consume bullets and gunpowder, but cloth bags containing gunpowder are often kept.

bannerclickedpopup.deletecolonydescription: Removing the last marker of a colony will remove all npc's and make the colony useless. Type 'delete' below to see what you want.
bannerclickedpopup.noconfirmationdelete: The government is unaware of the deletion and it has not been confirmed.
bannerclickedpopup.placementfail: Please do not place your logo on this site

bannerplacementpopup.mustbeleader: Colony leaders must customize their flags.

managejobs.header_text: {0} You work easily. Prepare the job: {1}/{2}. Job done: {3} / {1}

colonymanagement.manageowners: I am responsible for the Lord

outpost.createdescription: Start a banner outpost in your inventory or get a bunch.

colonymanagement.recruitfailedbeds: <color=red>Cannot recruit enough children to recruit new colonists.</color>
colonymanagement.recruitfailednomeals: <color=red>Unable to recruit new colonists. There are not enough stocked food.</color>
colonymanagement.recruittext3: Settlers need food and beds for the day.
colonymanagement.recruittext4-2: Gives the next settler {0} a free meal.
colonymanagement.recruittext5-2: You can recruit {0} free hospital beds and {1} colonists, more than the general population.

selectcolony.nocoloniesthird: There are no foreign colonies on the list

trading.ruleincomingdescr2: If they are greater than {1} and we are less than {2} we take {0}.
trading.ruleoutgoingdescr2: If greater than {1} and less than {2}, send {0}.

commands.disableachievements: Because of your interaction with the environment, your achievements in this world are limited.
commands.disableachievementsfirst: To do this, first disable the event using the '/failures' command.

npc_died.individual: {0}: Date of death of colonists working on {1}: {2:2}

siegemode.main: Use the trim function on station {0}!

pipliz.guardgrenadeday: A day in the grenade squad
pipliz.guardhandcannonday: A Day in the Hand Cannon Troops
pipliz.guardhandcannonnight: Night of the Hand Cannon Guards

alarmbell.description: Fear lit the bell, and it lit the bell when the monster walked
alarmbell.name: Alarm Bell

animalcarcass.description: Provide animal carcasses to the source
animalcarcass.name: Native Animal Carcasses

anvil.description: Unlock Incus, the source of more important products like copper tools
anvil.name: Rhizome

archery.description: Open the gates with archers and screams, a more effective defense against monsters.
archery.name: Archer

astrolabe.description: Opens the Astrolabe, a navigation tool that helps you find biomes.
astrolabe.name: Astrolabe

blastfurnace.description: He quickly opened an orb of advanced metal.
blastfurnace.name: Oven Inspiration

brass.description: He opened the brass smooth tin. She's not proficient with weapons or tools, but her flexibility makes her perfect for any little part. You will need tin which can be bought or dug under the giant tree.
brass.name: Brass

bread.description: He spreads the bread. Use a colander to make flour and use it to bake Bread
bread.name: Bread

bricks.description: Clay can be fired as a new block type.
bricks.name: Brick

bronze.description: He discovered a way to make copper stronger by mixing it with fine and precious tin.
bronze.name: Bronze Age.

bronzelockbox.description: Brass opens the lock. An improved version of the air lock box. More storage, higher performance, lower risk.
bronzelockbox.name: Brass Padlock

caltrop.description: Once loaded, it unlocks a trap that slows mobs underneath it.
caltrop.name: Water Chestnut

chestluxury.description: Unlock advanced chests needed to unlock advanced skills.
chestluxury.name: Deluxe Box

chestprestige.description: Enter here and throw away all hopes for returns and percentages! The authority of the ark is a necessary authority. This program is designed to study colonies.
chestprestige.name: Permission Framework

chestresource.description: He opened the science chest needed to unlock advanced technology.
chestresource.name: Ark of Science

chickenmeal.description: Unlocked more complex solutions that made the colonists consume more of the mystery.
chickenmeal.name: chicken Amen

compass.description: It opens the world, a navigation tool to find your home
compass.name: Compass

constructiondigger.description: He works on the construction site of an excavation base.
constructiondigger.name: Excavator

constructiondiggerspecial.description: Build a base by excavating a special area
constructiondiggerspecial.name: Special Excavator

cook.description: Unlock cooks and fishermen to provide new food sources for your farmers.
cook.name: Chef

copperlockbox.description: Brass unlocks the lockbox. Placing points increases the colony's abilities. Beware: locks will attract more monsters to your colony.
copperlockbox.name: Air Lock Box

cotton.description: Unlock high-quality fabrics. Cotton plants can only grow on canes.
cotton.name: Noodle

dyeing.description: Learn how to grow flowers in the swamp to add color to the world.
dyeing.name: Paint

elevator.description: Open production elevators useful for traversing vertical spaces.
elevator.name: Elevator

elevatorhorizontal.description: Started production of horizontal elevators useful for horizontal space movement
elevatorhorizontal.name: Horizontal Lift

engineer.description: He is a mechanic and trap repairer. Engineers create traps and ammunition that can be used on monsters. Grab a charge near the trap and reload.
engineer.name: Engineer

failsafe.description: Unlocks the Sacred Failsafe, an emergency tool used to rid Sacred Points of monsters.
failsafe.name: Divine safeguard

farming.description: The farmer has already harvested wheat. The importance of wheat as a food product will only increase over time.
farming.name: countryside wheat

furnace.description: He opened the blacksmith's mouth and the worker continued
furnace.name: Casting

glassblower.description: Beginning the path of art glass
glassblower.name: Glass Blower

glider.description: The glider craft is unlocked allowing unpowered flight at higher altitudes.
glider.name: Glider

glidersteel.description: Lauunculus opened it and quickly attached itself to the terrifying apex.
glidersteel.name: Open Iron Glider

goldenstatue.description: Unlocked threat banners from other stations that can lure monsters to specific locations.
goldenstatue.name: Threat Banner

grassdirt.description: The fountain provides grass and mud
grassdirt.name: Herb and plant production

grenadelauncher.description: Unlock powerful weapons that can take out hordes of enemies from a distance.
grenadelauncher.name: Grenade Launcher

guntrap.description: Unlock powerful traps that can do massive damage.
guntrap.name: Cannon Trap

hemp.description: He started growing and buying marijuana in the swamp. To speed up, he rides on ropes and papers.
hemp.name: Three

iron.description: Progress through major stages for your colony by unlocking new materials needed for many items.
iron.name: Iron Age

jewellery.description: I am a jeweler who creates beautiful objects.
jewellery.name: Jeweler

lanterns.description: Turn on useful lanterns for lighting spaces
lanterns.name: Lamp

lathe.description: Unlocked complex machinery that allows farmers to quickly craft precision metal parts.
lathe.name: Metal Shelf

miner.description: He unlocked the miner. If you put the log into the dark stone, the settlers will keep coming back to you with this material.
miner.name: Pitman

monocular.description: Smart unlock tool for remote viewing
monocular.name: Monocular

mudbricks.description: Open mud brick, an inexpensive and simple building material
mudbricks.name: Mud brick

musket.description: Unlock new weapons. They do less damage than hand cannons, but have cheaper ammo, longer range, and faster reloads.
musket.name: Musket

nitro.description: ACAPNOS' explosive compound is required to unlock the powder. It is much dirtier than traditional gunpowder, allowing the development of more complex firearms with many moving parts.
nitro.name: Nitrocellulose

npcshop.description: He opened a grocery store where farmers could buy their daily food. A flag should be displayed if not found.
npcshop.name: Greengrocer

outposts.description: The outpost banner has been unlocked. They can be near and far to expand colonies.
outposts.name: Station

papermaking.description: He discovered hemp paper, a key part of scientific progress.
papermaking.name: Restraint

poison.description: Over time, you've unlocked the Poison Process, which is useful for dealing damage to monsters. Wisteria plants only grow on heather. Each Sage Harvest requires 10 nearby Sage Plants to work properly.
poison.name: Poison

porridge.description: It was discovered as a new type of flour by combining water and wheat.
porridge.name: Pulp

prestige1.description: The goal is to match your best powers and skills!
prestige1.name: Effective Self

prestige2.description: Business is a journey, not a destination.
prestige2.name: Dignity 2

prestige3.description: This is a place of honor. A great feat is mentioned here.
prestige3.name: Majesty 3

prestige4.description: The last mile is the longest!
prestige4.name: Fourth Period

prestige5.description: Miket! In fact, he achieved all of his goals.
prestige5.name: Principle V

printingpress.description: Unlocks the Press, a complex machine that allows you to expand production of popular books. It also unlocks precision brass parts required for many other machines.
printingpress.name: Press Down

projectiletrap.description: He opens the trap and once loaded is thrown aside by the mighty monster.
projectiletrap.name: Project Pitfalls

recursiveknowledge.description: We help you make books by utilizing books so that you can make more books.
recursiveknowledge.name: Retrospective Self-improvement

researcher.description: Unlocks a researcher who studies nearby cabinets to increase their knowledge.
researcher.name: judge

ropetrap.description: Disarms a trap that freezes nearby monsters for 10 seconds when a monster passes by.
ropetrap.name: Rope Trap

sacredhouse.description: Unlock Sacred Points to expand the number of Sacred Points your failsafe can use.
sacredhouse.name: My Sanctuary

scribe.description: Unlocks a scribe who peruses books for new ideas. The clerk needs 10 shelves at close range. The scribe emptied them, but they were refilled.
scribe.name: Scholar

statistics.description: Statistics unlock tables. You can see it in the colony's behavior when deployed and used.
statistics.name: Statistical Office

steel.description: Unlocked iron, lead and mineral oil. These resources are needed to build modern machines. Lead mines were discovered in swamps and coal was deposited under giant trees.
steel.name: Iron, Lead and Mineral Oil

steellockbox.description: Open chests to get more energy.
steellockbox.name: Steel Lock Box

steeltools.description: It will unlock more powerful tools that will allow farmers to work more efficiently.
steeltools.name: Steel Tools

stonemason.description: Useful stones are unlocked to add a variety of buildings.
stonemason.name: Mason

tabulator.description: Unlock complex machines that process data and store it in hacked boxes.
tabulator.name: Tabulator

tailoring.description: A tailor who can turn thread into linen and other items. A good source of cotton and linen
tailoring.name: Cutter

tanner.description: Membranes after the opening of the tannery, which is important for leather production
tanner.name: Shortcake

toolshop.description: Unlocks a tool deployment panel that colonists move to use their tools. If you don't find it, go to the sign.
toolshop.name: Deployment Tool

trader.description: They were used to speed up trade between colonies. It's for players, not trading with stations.
trader.name: Merchant

trading.description: Unlock the Merchant Hub, a place to buy and sell
trading.name: Merchant Center

writer.description: Open Authors, Movies and Science Books. It is important for acquiring advanced knowledge.
writer.name: Author

areaselection.description: Choose here whether to delete the realm or not.

itemselector.description: Select the project type to use

limits.description: Colonizers run until the maximum supply reaches the pile.
limits.group2: Select one of several groups for that employee. A reasonable threshold would fit all of these workers into the same group.

hoverpriority.b:
A recipe with priority +++ has been created. 
Recipes with priority + are created last.

limits.wrongcolony: The next part of the colony is selected.

merchantui.selltext2: There are currently {0} products in the store.

specialblockremoval.description: Removing this type block {0} may cause community issues. what do you want me to do?

toolconstruction.description: Choose the area type you want to create.
toolconstruction.destroyerb: Destroyers are needed in this area

tooljob.berrya: Simple and quick food, start here!
tooljob.builderb: After selecting a category, a menu will open where you can select a region.
tooljob.chickenfarmera: Raise chickens in a barley field
tooljob.construction2: This will open another menu where you can select the build type.
tooljob.constructionjobb: The next location is in the construction area.
tooljob.description: Choose the area type you want to create.
tooljob.diggera: Let him dig a field in the world
tooljob.diggerspeciala: Delete a specific type from an area
tooljob.dyer1: Add some color to make life less boring.
tooljob.dyer2: This will open up another city with more job opportunities.
tooljob.insidearea: Cannot be placed in an area.
tooljob.noconstructionareanearby: There are no construction sites nearby.

toolshop.description: Settlers require a custom minimum stack level to use certain tools. Users can use all kinds of knowledge.

page1_2.text1: First, find a good location for your first colony. Relatives advise watering and farming.
page1_2.text2: The flag is the heart of the colony. Click the selected standard tool to drop it on the floor. Press '2' to select. When settlers are recruited, a long shadow is displayed on the banner wherever monsters spawn.
page1_2.text3: Colonists can be recruited at this location. Press 'i' to open the interface. Drag the bed from the stack to the shortcut bar below. To place a bed, right-click on the floor to place the bed.
page1_2.text4: Open the interface and enter the colony page. Press 'Recruit' to recruit settlers.

page2_2.description: They are essential for growth and health.
page2_2.text1: Settlers need one meal a day. Buy at your local or nearby grocery store. Without food, the settlers would starve to death. Recruiting new settlers is expensive.
page2_2.text2: The farmers' first food was strawberries. Press 'I' to select command tool. Click Open and select Berry Farmer. Right click to start setting up farm berries, then right click anywhere to finish. You need lots of them!
page2_2.text3: To start making the bed, you'll need to build an artisan's table. Left click to cut trees and dig up stone shards for collection.
page2_2.text4: To cheat, click the Tinker icon in the left sidebar. Go to Bed Like the berry farm, farmers who were out of work volunteered to work.

page3_2.text1: Workers go to collect crates and components from piles and improve the pile's construction. They are in standard cages if they are not already in cages.
page3_2.text2: Many tasks can or require the use of tools. Different tools have different costs, durability, and production speed bonuses. Artisans automatically produce stone tools.
page3_2.text3: Use your knowledge to unlock new tasks, items and features. Open the knowledge page in the tool to review requirements and unlock new skills available.
page3_2.text4: When you unlock the miner craft, the tynker will spawn a ”miner job”. Dig them into dark rocks or mines to support my settlers.

page4_2.description: Defend your colony against the monsters of the night!
page4_2.text1: Unlock adds some lore to the threat. This is evident on the right side of the UI. After the first 25, we will slowly add apprentice settlers. As the threat level increases, more and stronger monsters will appear.
page4_2.text2: Defend your colony center by building walls and digging trenches in monster-free areas. I like to put farming etc in the “monster zone“ outside. Farmers will put the area to sleep at night.
page4_2.text3: Your tynkkerer will produce the 'Night Slinger Cohort' item. Put it in the colony to let the wheels refresh while you work at night.
page4_2.text4: Progressing through the tech tree unlocks new guards, traps, and divine failures.

page5_2.description: Trade and scale for unique resources
page5_2.text1: Unlock and install Merchant Hub. Right-click to open the interface. Earn points by selling colony items. Points can be spent on upgrades, such as colonist caps on the Colony Points page, among other things.
page5_2.text2: The world has many realms with unique abilities. There are snow-capped mountains, myrtle-covered plants, swamps, and towering trees. Unlock and equip the astrolabe for easy finding.
page5_2.text3: Unlock outposts and purchase outpost flags to take with you on your explorations. Set up the launch pad. Its supplies and scientific advances are shared with the main colony and other garrisons. To access our resources, please create a website in any of the above countries.

page6_2.text1: For some actions you need to define 'Harvest' and 'Source' blocks. In most cases, each collection block requires 10 resource blocks.
page6_2.text2: The Reapers recruit tenants to work there as front desk attendants. The settler will attempt to visit a nearby plaza (in this case, a full shelf) before starting.
page6_2.text3: The log harvester empties the source, but the source itself regenerates logs over time. A ratio of 1 to 10 ensures long-term equilibrium.

mousemenu.sensitivitylock: They pick up the ax sense

languagemenu.coverage: This site is {0:F1}% full. Check out our forums or github repository for help locally.
languagemenu.wiptext: Work in progress. This does not include all text from the game and some translations may be less than others.

videomenu.restarttoapply: (*) Requires game restart for full implementation.

singleplayermenu.confirmdeletedescription: I want to delete the current folder. What are you doing;
singleplayermenu.legacyworldhint: You have chosen the world as your legacy. Increasing this amount will require older versions of Colony to survive. You can set Steam to receive older versions by going to the game properties and selecting older versions in the Betas tab.

modschanged.disabled: '{0}' is disabled or missing but was previously used.
modschanged.main:
The world is loading '{0}', but some methods have changed. 
This may cause problems.

singleplayermenu.nosubscribeditems: They couldn't find anyone with the factory signature

tooltip.craftingblock: Orders a colonist to work here as a {0}
tooltip.crate: Colonists will move to one of these blocks to get or deposit items every so often
tooltip.guard-general: Orders a colonist to guard this position
tooltip.is-edible: Meal item, colonists will eat one meal every day
tooltip.is-sanctified: Receive {0} sacred points when colonists eat this meal
tooltip.miner: Orders a colonist to repeatedly mine the dark stone ore block underneath
tooltip.npcshop: Colonists will visit this or the banner to get their daily meal
tooltip.pointtrader: You can buy and sell things for points here
tooltip.requires-water: Must be placed next to water to function
tooltip.statisticsboard: Interact with this block to view statistics of your colony
tooltip.threatstatue-general: Pulls threat from other outposts towards the outpost it's placed in, while also causing some threat itself
tooltip.tool-always-usable: Always available, does not require items
tooltip.tool-general: Tools are used by many jobs to accelerate crafting
tooltip.toolshop: Colonists will visit this or the banner to get new tools when needed
tooltip.trap-explosive-range: Affects an area with radius {0} on hit
tooltip.trap-filter-1000hp: Only triggers on monsters with at least 1000 hp
tooltip.trap-filter-unslowed: Only triggers on monsters not yet slowed
tooltip.trapfixer: Orders a colonist to restock nearby traps during the day
tooltip.trap-general: Trap item, awaits monsters to pass along and triggers. They will be refilled during the day by Trapfixer colonists
tooltip.trap-slows: Slows monsters to {0} times their speed
tooltip.trap-style-front: Triggers from monsters to the front

typeuses.alarmbell: Rings an alarm when it detects monsters walking over it
typeuses.alkanet: In real life, a source of red dye
typeuses.astrolabe: Equip in the hotbar to see the way to special biomes
typeuses.berry: A single berry. Not worth the effort of eating it!
typeuses.berrybush: Colonists can plant these for easy food
typeuses.berrymeal: A bunch of berries prepared to form a delicious meal
typeuses.bookcase: These are 'harvested' by researchers and automatically regenerate their content. Placing 10 of them for every researcher ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.bookcase1: These are 'harvested' by researchers and automatically regenerate their content. Placing 10 of them for every researcher ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.bookcase2: These are 'harvested' by researchers and automatically regenerate their content. Placing 10 of them for every researcher ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.bookcasefilled: These are 'harvested' by researchers and automatically regenerate their content. Placing 10 of them for every researcher ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.bread: A dry piece of bread without any spread or filling. Bleh
typeuses.breadmeal: Bread made tasty with a perfect berry jam
typeuses.bricks: It's a Dutch game, after all
typeuses.cherryblossom: The pinkest thing in the game
typeuses.clay: I wish you could touch it
typeuses.coalore: Warning: might cause climate problems. Can be found directly below mammoth trees.
typeuses.compass: Equip in the hotbar to see the way to colonies and outposts
typeuses.copper: Somewhat soft metal, but quite useful
typeuses.coppertools: You can't even cut bread without tools
typeuses.failsafe: Emergency defense mechanism using Sacred Points
typeuses.furnace: Uses firewood as fuel to craft bronze ingots and bricks
typeuses.glider: Places a glider launcher; Enter one by right-clicking it and navigate by aiming while holding forward
typeuses.glidersteel: Like the regular glider launcher, but this one launches you much higher into the air
typeuses.goldingot: Was once used to guarantee the value of paper money
typeuses.goldore: Can also be found in ore beneath snowy mountains
typeuses.grindstone: Used to grind wheat into flour
typeuses.hollyhock: A laxative in real life. Not in-game. Yet.
typeuses.ironore: Mined with an iron pickaxe that's made of iron ore
typeuses.lanternred: These are popular in Amsterdam too
typeuses.leavestaiga: I've got a Christmas feeling now
typeuses.leavestemperate: Try to jump into a pile of these from a high tower
typeuses.linen: Lingerie means underwear made of linen
typeuses.logtemperate: Like an output log, but different
typeuses.monocular: Equip in the hotbar to take a closer look at the world
typeuses.npcshop: Colonists visit here once a day to gather food and happiness items
typeuses.planks: Now with 4 times the volume of logs!
typeuses.researcherdesk: Researches require bookcases nearby in order to find data for their research!
typeuses.sand: Does not mix well with snakes
typeuses.scribedesk: Scribes requires 10 scroll shelves nearby in order to find data for their research!
typeuses.scrollshelf: These are 'harvested' by scribes and automatically regenerate their content. Placing 10 of them for every scribe ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.scrollshelf1: These are 'harvested' by scribes and automatically regenerate their content. Placing 10 of them for every scribe ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.scrollshelf2: These are 'harvested' by scribes and automatically regenerate their content. Placing 10 of them for every scribe ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.scrollshelffilled: These are 'harvested' by scribes and automatically regenerate their content. Placing 10 of them for every scribe ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.silicasand: Found below sand in the Heath biome
typeuses.splittingstump: A quicker way to split wood into firewood
typeuses.stove: Used to fill the surrounding area with delicious smells
typeuses.sulfur: Found deep underground in the Heath biome
typeuses.tin: Can also be found in ore beneath snowy mountains
typeuses.water: Will flood everything if let loose
typeuses.waterpump: Allows getting water without being near water
typeuses.wheat: A colonist with a grindstone will turn this into flour
typeuses.wisteriajob: One harvester needs 10 wisteria plants nearby. These plants can only be grown in heaths.
typeuses.wisteriaplant: Placing 10 of these for every wisteria harvester ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.wisteriaplantempty: Placing 10 of these for every wisteria harvester ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.wolfsbane: Prevents wolves from attacking your colony
typeuses.zinc: Can be found directly below mammoth trees.
